name: places/ChIJj7t6HBP2wokRINT5VLT1pss
formattedAddress: 242 W 123rd St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 242 W 123rd St, New York, NY 10027-5428, USA

editorialSummary.text: An 1890s townhouse featuring 4 individually decorated rooms with shared bathrooms.

originalText.text: We stayed here back at the start of October and had an amazing stay. The rooms are clean and full of character, the owner is incredibly friendly and helpful, and if you’re lucky there will be live jazz on downstairs. The location is amazing as you’re only a few minutes from the metro and the price is about as good as it gets in Manhattan!

text.text: We stayed here back at the start of October and had an amazing stay. The rooms are clean and full of character, the owner is incredibly friendly and helpful, and if you’re lucky there will be live jazz on downstairs. The location is amazing as you’re only a few minutes from the metro and the price is about as good as it gets in Manhattan!

originalText.text: My go-to place in NYC.  Extremely reasonable and very comfortable, this place is like stepping back in time.  Beautifully appointed bedrooms with antique touches.  You share a bathroom with one other room; bedrooms have private sinks.  Easy access to subway and plenty of shops/cafes nearby.

text.text: My go-to place in NYC.  Extremely reasonable and very comfortable, this place is like stepping back in time.  Beautifully appointed bedrooms with antique touches.  You share a bathroom with one other room; bedrooms have private sinks.  Easy access to subway and plenty of shops/cafes nearby.

originalText.text:
We had a great stay here at the Harlem Flophouse. Nice, large and comfortable room in a truly unique and absolutely charming house. If you are looking for something else than a regular NYC hotel room, you should try this!  Although the bathrooms are shared, there was a sink in the room and with only 4 guest rooms the 2 available bathrooms were more than enough (only one shower available though).

The location is very good, in the middle of the interesting Harlem neighborhood as well as lots of restaurants/bars and the Central Park closely reachable.

The house itself is located in a very calm street and with a room facing the back we could not believe to be in the middle of NYC, it was so quiet.

René was very communicative via mail, informing us about a construction going on in the house next door and did quickly answer any questions!

Definitely would come again and recommend it.

originalText.text: We had an amazing stay at the flophouse. The house has lots of character and the rooms are very well maintained and spotless. Rene is a great host and its always great to support independent business owners. We'll definitely be back when we're in NYC again!

text.text: We had an amazing stay at the flophouse. The house has lots of character and the rooms are very well maintained and spotless. Rene is a great host and its always great to support independent business owners. We'll definitely be back when we're in NYC again!

originalText.text:
What’s the first thing that comes to mind when you think of a hotel? For me it is a fresh and clean bed.

While the Harlem Flophouse provided a wonderful historical atmosphere and we did feel grateful for the opportunity to stay there, I was really saddened by the bed situation. The bedding reminded me of a frat house. Mismatched, cheap, polyesterish, and smelling anything but fresh. I found the fleece comforter with a stag print particularly out of place. I have seen sustainability argued elsewhere in the replies to reviews, and while I agree that that’s a valuable goal, there are excellent natural ways to make laundry smell good, like organic detergents or essential oils. I think cotton or linen sheets would match the historic vibe better, too. The old stuff could be donated. The same applies to the towels.
The historical charm would have come across better with more consistency and less random clutter. The bar of soap seemed extremely old and didn’t smell nice, which made me feel stressed about cleanliness throughout my stay.

Our check-in experience was quite smooth, we loved that the radio was playing in our room, and we loved the location - make sure to grab a coffee at nearby Double Dutch.

We didn’t run into any other people or staff during our stay, but it was quite difficult to find a time slot for the shower.

I think this place has great potential and deserves even more attention to detail!
